data.title: ATP CHAMPIONS Race 2000 - Steve G Tennis
data.meta_description: ATP CHAMPIONS Race 2000 - Steve G Tennis
data.text: Inside Mark Miles outlines the ATP Tour’s high-tech future—See page 4 Official News of the ATP Tour Volume 10 Issue 37 November 6, 2000 www.atptour.com Ferreira Captures Stuttgart Shield, Wins First Title in Four Years STUTTGART, Germany—Playing some of the best tennis of his life in a match of high drama, Wayne Ferreira defeated Lleyton Hewitt 7-6(6), 3-6, 6-7(5), 7-6(2), 6-2 to lift the Tennis Masters Series - Stuttgart shield and claim his first title in four years. The South African came back from two sets to one down to overcome his 19- year-old adversary in 4 hours, 11 minutes. It was the second Tennis Masters Series title of Ferreira’s career following his win in Toronto in 1996 – his last tournament win. “It's just fantastic,” said Ferreira.“To finally win a tournament as big as this, in this stage of my career, it's probably the best thing ever.” After losing a heart-breaking third set after forcing a tie-break from 5-1 down, Ferreira's Jiri Novak and David Rikl win Stuttgart doubles—See page 2 hopes looked to have gone. But he had other ideas.“I felt I could still win it,” he said.“I wasn't going to give up, put it that way. I had come too far for that.” It was tough on Hewitt, who had scored impressive wins over Richard Krajicek, Tim Henman, Greg Rusedski and Yevgeny Kafelnikov to reach his first Tennis Masters Series final. But with Ferreira playing the match of his life, a virus that had been bugging Hewitt for the past few months began to take its toll. “My whole life I've had to rely on a lot of fitness,” said Hewitt.“With my game I can go sort of all day. It just wasn't there today. To Wayne's credit though he played some great points, put a lot of pressure on my serve when I was serving for the set.” With his final appearance, Hewitt Stuttgart Review, Page 2➔ NOTES & QUOTES Former pro Johan Kjellsten has joined the ATP Tour as Deputy Director Public Relations, focusing on northern Europe including France. Benito Perez-Barbadillo, who took on extra STARS responsibilities in Latin America last year, will add to his responsibilities promoting in the Latin American region. He will continue to focus on southern Europe and will promote the increasing number of top players from these regions.“Johan brings to the Tour a wealth of Tennis background from virtually every aspect of the game coupled with the high energy and enthusiasm necessary to take on a very challenging role,” said Matthew Rapp, the ATP Tour’s Vice President Public Relations.“Benito has a demonstrated knowledge of the market place and the players from southern Europe and Latin America and will help us increase media coverage in these key markets.” Dr. Rudiger Schmidt-Wiethoff has received the ATP Tour Tournament Physician of the Notes & Quotes, Page 2➔ ATP CHAMPIONS RACE 2000 LEADER BOARD Lleyton Hewitt jumped two places to sixth on the ATP Champions Race 2000 Leader Board after reaching his first Tennis Masters Series final in Stuttgart. Despite losing to South Africa’s Wayne Ferreira, who moves to 11th position, the Australian teenager gained ground on Yevgeny Kafelnikov in fifth place. Magnus Norman clinched the fifth spot in the Tennis Masters Cup - Lisboa after reaching the third round in Stuttgart, while Gustavo Kuerten mantained his slender lead at the top and he has his sights firmly on the year end No. 1 spot.“It is my goal,” said the Brazilian.“I see myself with a chance [and] I’m well prepared. I think it’s my highest goal so far.” POS/PREV PLAYER/NAT PTS NEXT EVENT COMMENTS ✔1st (1st) Kuerten, Gustavo/BRA* 664 Lyon Top seed in Lyon, seeking first career indoor title ✔2nd (2nd) Safin, Marat/RUS* 661 St. Petersburg Star back in front of his Russian fans in St. Petersburg ✔3rd (3rd) Sampras, Pete/USA* 637 TMC - Lisboa Wimbledon champion will be back at Tennis Masters Cup - Lisboa ✔4th (4th) Norman, Magnus/SWE 621 TMS - Paris Clinched fifth spot in Lisbon after reaching Stuttgart third round 5th (5th) Kafelnikov, Yevgeny/RUS 543 St. Petersburg Russian going for his second title on home ground in St. Petersburg 6th (8th) Hewitt, Lleyton/AUS 505 TMS - Paris Aussie teenager reached first TMS final in Stuttgart, jumps two spots 7th (6th) Corretja, Alex/ESP 450 Lyon Former Lyon champ seeking title No. 6 of the year in France 8th (7th) Enqvist, Thomas/SWE 441 Lyon Relinquished Stuttgart title with second round loss, third seed in Lyon ✔9th (9th) Agassi, Andre/USA* 433 Lyon Making his Lyon debut as second seed this week 10th (10th) Henman, Tim/GBR 390 TMS - Paris Brit gearing up for TMS - Paris challenge Qualification: The top seven players in the ATP Champions Race 2000 as of November 27 will qualify for the Tennis Masters Cup - Lisboa. The eighth position will go either to a current Grand Slam winner who isn’t in the Top 8, or the eighth player in the ATP Champions Race. *= Players who have won a 2000 Grand Slam title. ✔= Players who have qualified for Tennis Masters Cup - Lisboa.
